Soal Eks Napi Korupsi Ikut Pilkada, Tito ingin Dengarkan Aspirasi
06 Nov 2019, 09:50 by Andita Rahma, Kukuh S. Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta-Menteri Dalam Negeri Tito Karnavian mengatakan ingin mendengar aspirasi publik terlebih dahulu ihwal wacana larangan bekas napi korupsi maju dalam Pemilihan Kepala Daerah (Pilkada) 2020 masuk ke dalam Undang-Undang Pilkada.
Karena itu Tito enggan mengambil sikap terlebih dahulu. "Saya sebagai Mendagri tidak mau mengambil sikap dulu, saya lebih mengutamakan mendengar aspirasi publiknya, publik mau mengambil prinsip pembalasan atau koreksi," ujar Tito di Mako Brimob Polri, Kelapa Dua, Depok, pada Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Tito menjelaskan bahwa pemasyarakatan pada zaman dahulu menerapkan konsep pembalasan. "Dulu orang ditangkap, diproses, masuk penjara itu konsepnya membalas. Supaya dia bikin susah orang, dia harus dibikin susah. Dengan cara masuk penjara, maka disebut dengan prison, penjara," ujar dia melanjutkan.
Namun konsep penjara kini telah berubah. Tito menyinggung teori kriminologi yaitu fight crime, not the criminal. Di mana, yang harus diperangi adalah perbuatannya, bukan orangnya.
"Sehingga orang yang berbuat kejahatan, mereka dianggap melakukan perbuatan yang menyimpang, sehingga harus dikoreksi, prinsipnya adalah prinsip untuk mengoreksi dan merehabilitasi," kata Tito.
Alhasil, menurut penilaian Tito, apabila hak politik para napidana korupsi dicabut, maka itu secara tak langsung pemerintah telah menerapkan prinsip pembalasan. Namun, dengan prinsip rehabilitasi, para narapidana korupsi dapat diberi kesempatan kembali.
Kendati demikian, Tito kembali menegaskan bahwa hal tersebut masih terus diperbincangkan. "Itu masih menjadi wacana, dibicarakan, dari KPU untuk diajukan, dibicarakan kemarin sudah di Komisi II DPR. Prinsip dari kami, terserah publik," ujar Tito.

Regarding Ex-Corruption Prisoners Joining Local Election, Tito wants to hear aspirations
Nov 6 2019, 09:50 by Andita Rahma, Kukuh S. Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Home Affairs Tito Karnavian said that he wanted to hear public aspirations in advance about the discourse on the prohibition of ex-convicted corruption in the 2020 Regional Head Election in the Pilkada Law.
Because of that Tito was reluctant to take a stand first. "I as the Minister of Home Affairs do not want to take a stand first, I prefer to hear the aspirations of the public, the public wants to take the principle of retaliation or correction," said Tito at the Police Mobile Brigade Mako, Kelapa Dua, Depok, on Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Tito explained that prison in ancient times applied the concept of retaliation. "In the past people were arrested, processed, and went to prison, the concept of retaliation. In order for him to make things difficult for people, he must be made difficult. By going to prison, it is called prison, prison," he continued.
But the concept of prison has now changed. Tito touched on the theory of criminology, namely fight crime, not the criminal. Where, what must be fought is the action, not the person.
"So that people who commit crimes, they are considered to have committed deviant acts, so they must be corrected, the principle is the principle of correcting and rehabilitating," said Tito.
As a result, according to Tito's assessment, if the political rights of corruption convicts are revoked, then the government has indirectly applied the principle of retaliation. However, with the principle of rehabilitation, corrupt prisoners can be given the opportunity to return.
Nevertheless, Tito reiterated that this matter was still being discussed. "That is still a discourse, discussed, from the KPU to be submitted, yesterday was discussed in the House of Representatives Commission II. The principle from us, is up to the public," said Tito.
